subject: Productivity
title: Redefining Productivity
description: A short lesson to help you apply Redefining Productivity.

hook.text: For centuries, productivity meant more output per hour. That definition is breaking down.

buildup.text: Knowledge work output is hard to measure. A brilliant idea takes minutes. A useless report takes weeks.

discovery.text: Some economists now argue productivity should measure outcomes and wellbeing, not just output volume.

twist.text: A person who works less but produces better results is more productive â€” but old metrics miss this.

climax.text: The future of productivity may measure impact and sustainability, not speed and quantity.

punchline.text: Productivity isn't about doing more. It's about mattering more.

quiz.question: How might the definition of productivity change in the future?
options: Focus on outcomes and wellbeing instead of just output volume
